title: What is Apple's design studio like? - Quora

response.answer_text: The studio is so secretive, it’s sometimes referred to as “the studio behind the iron curtain.” Access to the design studio is limited to a select few Apple employees. Since there are product prototypes in the design studio, Apple obviously has to take precautions to prevent leaks. On very limited and special occasions, they will allow the media in for a tour or share sneak peeks of the studio in promotional videos. The studio contains the following:1) Presentation Space 2) Kitchen 3) Designer’s Workstations 4) Jonathan Ive’s office 5) CAD Studio 6) CNC Shop Here is a virtual tour of the entire design studio. In this video, we can see how closely the studio resembles the design of Apples’ retail stores. The studio presentation space are the same tables you’ll find in any Apple store. The entrance and foyer have aluminum walls whereas, fiberglass walls divide most of the rooms inside of the studio. Of course, everything is minimalist and ultra modern with attention to functionality and simplicity.  There’s real footage of the studio in the “Designed by Apple in California” Chronicles 20 Years of Apple Design video.
